channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain totally blocked with road dirt., 11th January
item.description:
Out side Cotswold View by the pedestrian crossing point. On the left hand side of Shurdington Road travelling north. I believe drain has been blocked for some time but has only recently become a problem with the heavy rain causing a large puddle to form outside my house. Unfortunately the passing traffic caused my front garden to flood.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pothole and collapsed lane previously reported has been notified as fixed but there is no evidence of any attempt to repair the problem, 11th January
item.description:
This is on Dog Lane 5m uphill from the junction with Dark Lane. The pot hole on one side of Dog Lane and the collapsed roadway on the other side of the lane was previously reported under web ref 6854998 enq 22064937 and I was notified yesterday that it had been fixed. There is no evidence of any repair having been done and this continues to present a real hazard not just for vehicles but to walkers and horse riders as drivers have to manage a chicane at this point trying to avoid the pothole on one side of the lane and the collapsed roadway on the other. As you can see from the photos taken today I can not understand how this can be recorded as ‘fixed’.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep potholes on Glenfall Way where previous patch repairs are breaking up, 11th January
item.description:
There are some deep potholes on Glenfall Way close to the junction with London Road where a previously patched section of road is breaking up. A couple of them are very deep. One of the photos shows the section with the potholes clearly visible even from a distance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenfall Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedges and trees overhanging, 11th January
item.description:
All along the road causing damage to larger vehicles. The pot holes are also causing an issue cannot get collection vehicles up here
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hunters Hill Lane, Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The lane slippage reported to you previously has been reported back as having been fixed but only one part of the same sunken area of the lane has been fixed., 11th January
item.description:
Previous report web ref 6854945 enq 22064936 regarding slippage of Dog Lane outside Willowbank has not been fixed despite the report received yesterday that it has. Having seen the repairers by their van having started the repair I asked them whether they were going to fill all the sunken area as far as the telegraph post which they said they would but this hasn’t been done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole by back of Aldi, 11th January
item.description:
The pothole is getting worse and the predicted ice rink from the flowing water is happening. I have reported the water 3 times, each time being told its being sorted in the next weeks. Please do something.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
